Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hampton standards”
Reviews.Author: tothegypsy
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Honors Gold member, and I am quite partial to Hilton family properties. I'm rarely disppointed in one of their properites, but the Hampton Inn Miami Airport-West simply wasn't up to par with most Hampton properties. Check-in was painless, and the gentleman behind the counter was exceptionally friendly, greeted me as a Gold member, and even presented me with a nice welcome gift for being a gold member. After I got off the elevator, my first impression was the amount of carryout menus strewn down the hallway. As I opened the door, I nearly slipped on the menus shoved under my door. It's one thing if there are menus on the desk supplied by the hotel, but menus shoved under the door basically say that the hotel has a security issue. The room is standard Hampton fare, with a flat-screen TV, Cloud 9 bed, desk, micro/fridge, and chair. The bathroom was spacious and appeared to be updated recently. My biggest complaints had to do with lax housekeeping and general maintenance of the building: the showerhead was encrusted in mildew, there were water stains on the ceiling directly above the bed, and the carpet felt almost greasy. On top of that, the A/C unit was really loud and clicked on and off incessantly all night long. Net, this Hampton was priced lower than the others in Miami, and there's probably a reason for that. I honestly can't believe I blew 25,000 of my HHonors points on such a sub-par experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but please fix the air conditioner!”
Reviews.Author: jah1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to location and price. It is a nice property and the rooms are attractive. However I was unable to get much sleep because the AC unit would turn itself off and on every 5-10 minutes all night long. It was too hot to live without AC. So I woke up every time it changed its cycle. Breakfast was fine, lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hampton Inn Yet!”
Reviews.Author: NC7007
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, beds, and amenities. Very good hot breakfast and nice room. The pool is good and the hotel location is great for getting back to the airport or for using the hotel as a base to travel around the south Miami area. The real "jewels" of this hotel are the front desk personnel. They know and can direct you to the best restaurants in the area (and many are close enough to walk.) They also go out of their way to help in anyt way possible. I've stayed here several times and all the front desk people seem to be this way. This can't be an accident. It has to be a priority of management. I was greeted by name, given a small welcoming gift, and checked in quickly. The room was in perfect condition and cleaned and restocked perfectly daily fpr each of the days of our stay. I will return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive staff/accommodation - The Joneses, NB Canada”
Reviews.Author: Joan and Milton J
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Miami and found a wonderful welcome at Hampton Inn Miami-Airport West. The desk staff at this hotel were very pleasant and friendly,and offered to help us in any way they could. Our room was clean with many amenities making for a great 4-day stay. We certainly enjoyed a delicious hot buffet breakfast every morning--a great start to our day. We took advantage of the prompt and reliable shuttle service from and to the airport, and the pier as well. Thank you to all the Hampton Inn staff, with special thanks to Justin Rodriguez and the front desk staff. We have notified and thanked our travel agent at CAA for her assistance in helping us to find a great hotel that we wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: dos7940
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard Hampton Inn. Close to the airport burt not too close with a gas station right next store. It was easy to find right off the expressway. If you haven't tried a Hampton, this would not be a bad place to start. The service is always professional. The breakfast includes a hot dish (eggs), waffles and ceral.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to the Caribbean and wanted a hotel close to the airport. We checked in around 10PM and the atmosphere was cold and depressing. The room was standard, but so bleak that I immediately began to try to find another hotel for our return trip. We found a nicer hotel in the same vicinity for less $...The Sofitel. The breakfast fare was standard/mediocre. When we checked out and cancelled our return room, the agent did seem concerned and she inquired if there was anything wrong. I didnt have the heart to tell her it was just too depressing to return. On a positive note, the shuttle to the airport was on time with a very helpful driver.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: MoeKell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 1 night since we flew into Miami on one day and were leaving to drive to Key West the next. The staff at the front desk was very pleasant and friendly. The rooms were clean but the bath room could use some upgrading. There were stains on the tub, Although I didn't think it was bad, my husband hated the bed. He thought it was one of the most uncomfortable ones he had ever slept in. Overall it was decen and sufficient for a short layover.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport, clean, friendly staff, great plane watching!”
Reviews.Author: hall0510
Reviews.Content: This stay was great! I arrived early and they were able to accommodate an early check in. The hotel was very close to the airport. I liked watched the airplanes land as it is between the two runways. If you want the best view of them landing, request the north side of the hotel. Even though it was close to the runways, I didn't find any problems with the airplane noise, it's like they built it that way (har har har). The fitness area was fine, had weights and cardio. There are some nice restaurants a few blocks west. Overall, it was a great stay and I will be back next time I am in the area for business. I had a rental car, but they did have a shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: Feezeeweezee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a long flight from Australia and then heading to Colombia the next day. It was comfortable, clean and had everything we needed. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there are a couple across the road in the strip mall - we ate at the Cuban restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HAMPTON INN BUT POOR SERVICE AND SOME RUDE STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hamton Inn in Oct 2011. I was traveling on business. My 11 year old daughter was traveling with me on this trip. So we landed in Miami and picked up a rental car, I called the hotel for direction from the Airport I was shuffeled around to 3 people no one could give me directions. I followed the directons the last person gave us we got lost for over 2 hours. Come to find out the Hotel is about 2 miles from the airport. Well we arrive at the hotel around 7pm the hotel appered nice and the staff was nice. We went up to the 2nd floor my 11 year old took the keys and walked ahead of me to open the room. To my suprise they gave us keys and checked us into an occupied room. My 11 year old daughter walked in on a couple doing there thing ( if you can read what I am saying ). I returned to the front desk rather upset they did change us to a new room. The only other problem we had is on Saturday I went to the front desk to extend our stay till Monday due to problems with our flight on Sunday. The front desk girl said it was taken care of and redone our keys. On Sunday about 1:15pm the housekeeper asked what time we were leaving I replied we are not we are staying till tomorrow. She said no your suppose to be checking out today by 1pm. I went to the front desk and a woman named Maria was working I told her how I had extened the stay the night before, she said no you are suppose to leave today and we are sold out so you have to leave. I replied this is not right can you please call the Manager. She said No she is off today and I am in charge and you have to leave. You have 10 min to vacate the room or you will be charged for another night. So we left and we were fourtunate the airline took care of us. When I got home that evening I called and spoke to the same girl that extened my stay on Sat, she said it was extended and she didnt know what happened and was so sorry. So I called the Hotel GM Angie the next morning she apoligized and said she didnt know what Marias problem was that she should have called her. She said Maria only works weekends. Angie did refund me for the entire stay so she did do what was right. I am a Hilton Honor Gold Member and I appricate what Angie done to take care of the situation. All in all the stay was ok. I might stay here again if ever in the area to give them a 2nd chance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect overnight stop for precruise”
Reviews.Author: Letsg0m0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night before leaving on our cruise the next day. Room was very comfortable. Breakfast was satisfying. Quick ride to Port of Miami. The hotel filled our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: kendra917
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. The wait time to check in was a little long, as only one person was working the front desk but overall experience was great. The rooms were very nice and clean, and the bathroom was immaculate. Very nice ameneties. The continental breakfast was delicious and they had a nice variety of things to choose from. The waffle maker was awesome. I traveled with 3 other family members and we took a cruise leaving out of the port of Miami. We took the shuttle from the hotel to the port and it was great. We left our vehicle at the hotel free of charge for the entire week until we returned, then took a cab from the port back to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great Staff but I Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: starchild101
Reviews.Content: This is quite a bizzarre review. Especially with all of the good things about this place, I just cannot recommend staying here. Always best to start with the good so lets start with the good: Shuttle service from the airport was great, call them up they were there in 15 minutes. They will also shuttle you to area restaurants at no charge. Hotel area is nice, we actually chose to walk to one of the restuarants in the area which was about a 20 minute walk. They also offer shuttle service to the cruise port for a reasonable fee. Front desk was very accommodating. Our intial room (we booked off of hotwire) they had put us in had a full size bed. We went down to the desk, requested a bigger bed and they put us in a room with a king size bed no problem. Room was very clean, nice big flat screen tv, nice size bathroom. The place offered free popcorn at night, and breakfast was better than average offering waffles, ham, bisquits and gravey in addition to your standard bagels and cereal. We purchased the shuttle service to the cruise port, and the shuttle was 30 minutes late and they refunded our fare for having to wait so long (we didn't even request it be returned nor did we complain it was late!). Very nice! So the big question is why wouldn't I stay here again. Well the answer it the bed! The bed comfort was horrible. Pillows had no fluff, bed was hard, just tossed and turned all night long and on top of that the air conditioner made this annoying clickety click sound all night long. We did not get a good night sleep to say the least. So this review is really bizzare, the hotel had so many really good things about it. It is just a shame the bed that was just so gosh darn awful. Replace the beds and I will definatly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BJ-69-UT
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay on my way to one of the Carribean islands. They picked me up within 15 minutes of calling them from the airport. As a Hilton Honors member, my welcome package was waiting in my room. The breakfast was good, the free internet was helpful, and the shuttle service back to the airport the next morning was timely. The room was quiet and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: camilor
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience but i think IT was mostly luck. I had to wait for 1 hour for the hotel shuttle to pick me up at the airport they picked me up only because i had to call them, when i arrived they offered a free frozen pizza ( well better than nothing). The general hotel wasnt as neet as the usual Hampton's ive stayed. The elevators were wet with puddles (i imagine from the pool). The room was ok. It is ok an overnight flight in Miami airport, but there are closer and better options

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this poorly-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leadbelly98
Reviews.Content: This is a below-average Hampton Inn and here is a list of items that need improvement during my recent stay (June, 2011). 1. Noisy room due to an old AC system 2. Breakfast was missing several items (there were no hot food available) 3. Breakfast area tables were not cleaned and the trash cans were overflowing 4. The fitness center had no towels In short, stay away from this poorly managed property. You can do much better at the Hilton Garden Inn or the Homewood Suites located 1/2 mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: UALsandiego
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstandingly friendly, all of them, at all times. That's a great plus. There is free breakfast, though I didn't try it, so I can't really speak to it. Airport shuttle is convenient and runs pretty much any time. When I called for them to pick me up from the airport, no one showed up or 20mins. I called again, and they apologized, saying the shuttle was stuck in traffic. They offered me to take a cab and they would pay for it. I waited another 10mins and then took advantage of their offer. THAT'S customer service! When I got my room, the floor was wet for some reason, and I couldn't figure out what it was (the liquid was all over the carpet, far away from the AC and also the bathroom. They offered to move me right away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: 1des
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised! Very comfortable bed, clean, spacious bathroom with high end finishes. Missed the breakfast because of a very early flight so a 'bag bkfst' was provided. Parked my car for a week for free with only a one night stay. Right off the Palmetto Expy. This was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good poeple and staff”
Reviews.Author: chingchang305
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very nice and the staff was the greatest ever. The whole surrounding is clean and well kept. Keep up the good work Hampton..

Reviews.Title: “Bit grubby, bit overpriced, needs a makeover asap!”
Reviews.Author: Hazy72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Miami. Good location for the airport and actually, very good location for last minute shopping, the Dolphin Mall and other malls are really nearby so if you have a car, this is place to stay. What let's the hotel down, is quite frankly, the state that the hotel is in. It is clearly used as a stopover for business people to meet and greet each other, or people like us, a stopover before flying home. The rooms stank with just general wear and tear, the carpets, walls etc were really dirty and it's a shame really. What I was impressed with and this is always a plus point with Hampton Inns is that they always offer great breakfasts, including hot food, which is fantastic value as it is included in the room rate. It is clearly well utilised by everyone and allows people to eat and then head off to whereever they need to go. The front staff were not friendly when we arrived, they looked miserable and couldn't care less but the staff on the front desk the following day were much happier and it was a breath of fresh air. Just a word of caution, the parking, great free parking but if you are coming from the airport or from the north, you will need to do a massive u-turn at the lights as the hotel is on the opposite side of the road, the access to the parking is a bit tight and make sure you know how to do a hill start in an automatic... not something we are used to in the UK with shift stick and the climb to the parking is very steep and you have to co-ordinate the keycard swip at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: maryjakubowski
Reviews.Content: Very polite staff....great free breakfast ...fancy bathrooms ...big TVs in rooms

Reviews.Title: “You can get better value and cleanliness at a Hostel”
Reviews.Author: tanyawilson27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do a lot of travelling both for business and for pleasure, and I can very confidently say that this was the absolute worst experience I have ever had in my many years of travel. Even worst than the most disgusting hostels that I experienced while travelling in Europe in my early 20s. We booked this suite in the summer and assumed that we booked enough ahead of time to receive a reasonably good room. We arrived at the Hampton Inn in the evening of December 3rd and ended up sitting down in the main lounge/tv area for 20 minutes as there was no staff on site for that long. We were finally able to check in and we went straight to our room. The moment we walked into our room, we were blasted with the smell of very recent cigarette smoke and cheap perfume and the room was filled with grey smoke. It hit us like a punch in the face and we were immediately coughing and hacking. My lung aren't great, so I had to go sit out in the main hallway to recovery while my husband went down to the lobby to ask for a different room. Without any exaggeration, it smelt like the hotel room had just finished being rented out by the hour and someone had gone in 30 minutes before we arrived and sprayed a whole bottle of perfume to try and hide the smoke smell (and other odors). It was overpowering! My husband soon learned that the hotel was full but the night manager apologized and said that we could probably get a refund if we talked to the day manager the next morning. The night manager seemed very embarrassed and wasn't at all surprised that we had complained - he was expecting it. My husband returned to the room and we just decided to go to bed and try to get some sleep. The problem was that this room only had a double bed and my husband is a very large man (220 pounds, into body building, you get the picture). He ended up letting me sleep on the bed and he slept next to me on the floor. I ended up having to open a whole bunch of coffee bean bags and have them laying around my face so that it would mask the dizzying perfume and smoke smell. We had a horrible sleep and in the morning went down to speak to the manager. As we were waiting for her, we noticed the plaque on the wall that stated that if their customers aren't 100% satisfied, their money would be refunded. They should really take that plaque down. We explained what had happened to the manager and she immediately stated that since we had purchased the hotel through Hotwire, there was nothing that could be done. We mentioned the 100% satisfaction guarantee, and she said that that only applied to their own customers and Hotwire customers were not offered the same standard. We were absolutely shocked by this. If Hotwire customers are not held to the same level of their other customers, they really should not be offering their hotels on Hotwire. The Hampton Inn manager was very abrupt and rude and took very little care in the fact that we had obviously just experienced the worst hotel night of our lives. She just couldn't wait to have us leave and absolutely looked down at us because we had purchased through Hotwire. In addition to this information, I can confirm that all other negative reports listed here on tripadvisor are absolutely true. This hotel is dirty, both in the lobby area as well as in the room. I will not be a repeat customer of Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: tc2121
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, but very bad service....do not think they will take you to the mall as the website says..

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stayinghome98
Reviews.Content: After an uncomfortable night and trying not to notice the unclean surroundings, being stuck in the elevator, I am now dealing with bed bug bites and finding bugs in my luggage! YUCK! I have stayed at Hampton Inns in the past and this is the worst I have ever encountered. I feel that the management was aware of the problem before we stayed and that is why the sir-conditioning was set to about fifty degrees both in the room and the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Don't depend on the shuttle from the cruiseport”
Reviews.Author: ambbrb
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for one night, a package that allowed us to leave our car at the hotel while we went on a cruise. The website said that the shuttle was $10 per person each way between hotel and cruiseport.. I called the hotel before booking online, and learned that the hotel's shuttle would provide transportation to the port, but could not, by law, pick us up there. I was told that when we returned to port, we should call the hotel , and they would arrange for a shuttle to come right away and pick us up. When we checked in and made a reservation for the shuttle the next morning, we were told that the cost was $12. We challenged that, and mentioned the website, and were charged $10. At checkin, and as we left the next morning,the information about the return trip was repeated, and we were given a business card with the hotel's phone number. When we returned to the cruiseport, I called the hotel, as I had been directed, and asked the staff person who answered the phone to schedule pickup. She kept asking for my reservation number ( I didn't have one), and kept asking me to spell my name. She also said that the cost would be $12. She put me on hold, then returned and repeated the same questions. I finally hung up, and we ended up taking a cab back to the hotel, and it cost considerably more than the $20 we had planned.. The room was nice, but the transportation problem was not a good way to end a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MiamiVacationsToday
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn Miami Airport west is awesome place to stay. I stayed there during the late Spring and was amazed with the services and rooms. Newly renovated lobby provides the refreshing feeling.. staff was very courteous and helpful. On top of that loved the fact that it was just minutes away from airport and 20 minutes from South Beach. Overall good place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Mani was a very hostile driver”
Reviews.Author: 1d_rsingh
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great except for one thing. It was our first time in Miami and we were told that the shuttle service was a courtesy if we needed a ride in the area as long as its not going to the airport. Mani(driver) and Angie(front desk) spent soo much time together that they had one head. They always lied and said the van was occupied when it was really parked up. Is that a way to care for tenants? Thats pure racialism. I hope they are working in another dept with their lack of hospitability next time I go there.

Reviews.Title: “Wet and smelly!!”
Reviews.Author: LKStremple
Reviews.Content: As soon as we checked in I had a bad feeling about the place because it smelled moldy and dirty. After checking in we made our way to go up to the fourth floor. On the way to the elevator, we saw that the entire first floor hallway had dryers and dehumidifiers drying the carpet. I figured that maybe they were cleaning the carpets down there and that was contributing to the smell. When we got to the fourth floor we saw that the hallways there were also being dried just like the first floor. It still smelled really bad. When we walked into our room the stench was worse and there was a puddle of water on the floor around the air conditioner that extended past the desk. The girl at the front desk was very apologetic and put us in a new room. The floor was dry but again, it smelled really bad. Even though the floor was dry you could feel the moistness in the air. We had a sheet of paper sitting on the desk and when we woke up the next morning it felt like it was sitting in a pile of water. We couldnâ€™t wait to get out of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fun64Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just west of the Palmeto by Miami International Airport. It has easy road access to most of Miami's major points. The hotel's interior has been recently renovated to very hight modern standards and the beds are just a dream. The staff is efficient and the breakfast is just right.

Reviews.Title: “Just not clean”
Reviews.Author: ChiefSadler
Reviews.Content: I've always loved staying at Hampton Inns - but t his one was dirty and the room smelled. Bathroom was nice though, the bed was very comfortable, and the large LCD TV was nice - though the remote wasn't very responsive.

Reviews.Title: “I felt safe and secure with your establishment and the room was great.”
Reviews.Author: izzy57
Reviews.Content: Going in the hotel was great because is felt and seemed secure. No one could enter the parking lot without a key to swipe and go through the gate. The hotel entrance was the same way. Without your key you could not get in. The only thing I would change is that the entrance door would open when you pulled up in your car. The door seemed to stay open longer then it needed too. Other then that everything seemed secure.

Reviews.Title: “Room needed work, ended up with a free night”
Reviews.Author: dleepenn
Reviews.Content: The bathtub stopper was broken and the room refrigerator was bad. We also noticed that the covers on the decorative pillows needed changing. We were not charged for the room after reporting these issues and the staff were most helpful. The room was clean otherwise and we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK For One Night”
Reviews.Author: ToddlerMum40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our way to South America, ok but think you can find better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Area and Breakfast....that's it”
Reviews.Author: raidergirlil
Reviews.Content: I am a die hard Hilton Family traveller for business and leisure. I used 80,000 Hilton Points to book rooms for our pre-cruise evening w/ Friends and Family. To make a long story short I got the points back. The check in took 23 minutes for anyone to get to the front desk (said she was in back making a reservation) The Van trip from the airport for both parties (9 people total) took over an hour - the property is 10 mins from the airport. I travel a lot....and have worked in hospitality my whole life; I give folks the benefit of the doubt. HOWEVER each and every one of us had something wrong with our rooms - no towels, (and no one to pick up the phone when we called...some of the phones didn't work either) bad HVAC, etc. etc. If you're patient the lobby and pool area are nice, and coming from Chicagoland in January - let's face it - almost ANYwhere in Miami is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: samantica
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent at the check-in time. The front desk coordinators have a good same of humor and empathize with most of the guest that passed by while I was at the business center. The rooms were very clean and neat. The surpervisors and managers are always present in the breakfast area helping the staff assisting all the guests. I felt at home. The room was very quite. They have also remodeled the entire hotel. It looks awesome and I could enjoyed my stay very much. Great atmosphere and customer service!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Regular hotel, not for business”
Reviews.Author: juansegura
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers basic accommodation services, service is regular to bad, rooms are ok, with all services, towels are ok, soap is cheap, bring yours, reception service feels like a truck MOTEL service, meaning no uniformed person, unshaved and bad attitude. Since the breakfast is included, the eat area looks unclean due to the nature of self service no waitress. It is really if you need to save little money (It is not cheap either) or want Hilton points and have no other option, stay here, other way use other hotels in the area, Intercontinental (5*), la quinta, Doral

Reviews.Title: “This is a dump”
Reviews.Author: sendmehome
Reviews.Content: I travel for business constantly and this Hampton Inn was just terrible. The eating area had wallpaper peeling off, dirt around the baseboard, missing baseboards. The room was average size with a very small TV. A window air conditioner that was so loud, you could hardly sleep. The breakfast fare was way below other Hampton standards. Several reviews indicated that this hotel had a bar. It does not. This hotel needs a total update.

Reviews.Title: “A little below par for a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: wilkins99
Reviews.Content: OK -- but not up to Hampton Inn's usually high standards. First, the hotel is undergoing rennovations which was not mentioned or their web site or confirming email. I find this practice deceptive. Second, the hotel is a little dumpy and the cleaning crew wasn't doing their job. Someone spilled a cherry soda in one of the elevators and it stayed in there for the entire 48 hours I was in the hotel (even after mentioning it to the front desk staff, where a sign proclaimed "let us know of any reason you wouldn't give us a 10 on a customer service survey!"). The internet didn't work when I first plugged in, but the really helpful and energetic maintenance supervior replaced the whole wall plug-in, which was severely corroded. Kudos to him to sticking with it until things worked! The room was good, the bathroom clean, and everything else was in good working order. Breakfast was good and pool looked good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Bajan_Mum83
Reviews.Content: I am overnighting and choose this location based on reviews on this site. The rating really should be a 2 but the staff are friendly. First off the free shuttle required a wait of over 35 minutes. I called the hotel 3 times. It was never mentioned that the shuttle only leaves on the hour which would have re-aligned my expectations. However the young driver was apologetic and friendly - but it was little consolation as I was extremely tired after awakening early to catch the flight. The front staff were also apologetic and assured me I would enjoy their comfortable beds. Unfortunately around 1:30 pm as I was trying to rest, drilling started. Yes they are undergoing rennovations! - a fact not mentioned on their website. Front desk again apologised and noted the noise can be heard from all rooms (did I believe them? no but when you are tired you really don't want to argue) I chose to go to the mall instead. My advice call the hotel directly and get an update on the rennovations before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for first night after a long haul flight”
Reviews.Author: creaseym
Reviews.Content: We flew in from the UK and after a 9 hour flight plus delays, were very glad we chose somewhere as convenient as this. The hotel is very clean throughout and has free secure parking, free internet, complimentary beverages 24hrs, and free breakfast. The beds were as comfortable as we like and although the hotel is near the airport (about 3 miles) there was no aircraft noise, or indeed any noise in our room. Breakfast available from 6am was also very welcome while we were getting used to the time difference. We stayed 2 nights before setting off on a grand tour of the Keys and Everglades. On the second day they didn't make up our room until about 4.30 pm, and as we were still tired, we would have liked to have gone back to bed for a nap before then. So that was a bit inconvenient, but I'm sure if we had asked for the room to be made up earlier they would have done it, so can't really be critical about that. All in all, just what we wanted and a good first stop.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic, good for one night.”
Reviews.Author: Ruthless333
Reviews.Content: We were flying home to England from Miami and needed a one night stop-over - nothing fancy or too expensive as it was literally just a place to sleep. We were allocated a room on level 4 - non smoking. The beds and pillows were clean and quite comfortable. The bedroom furniture was a bit tired looking as was the bathroom - but for the money it was OK - have been in pricier hotels that have not been as clean! The only main problem we encountered was the air conditioning unit being quite noisy. Previous hotels have had the modern units encased in the ceiling or wall and are very quiet in their operation - this was one was placed on the floor underneath the window and sounded very much like a diesel engine 'ticking over' until you turned it up and then it sounded like a diesel engine about to blow a gasket - also it was not very productive in keeping the room cool. Didn't bother with the inhouse food service [stops at 9.30pm I think] but ordered in, using a name we are familiar with in England, PIZZAHUT, they have the number on reception as it was not listed in the room brochure. It arrived direct to the door and was tasty and HOT! We took advantage of the inclusive breakfast, although the hot offerings didn't look to appetising the pastries were tasty and they had bagels, muffins, bread [with a toaster if you needed it] along with fruit, cereals and juices. Also I have to say that this was probably the best cup of tea I got whilst in USA! Free shuttle - if using to be collected from the airport you need to keep your eyes open and 'wave' it down - we were told to wait outside by American Airlines this we did........ but at the beginning of the terminals [A] when really we should have been further along the path nearer to terminal [C]. Had we been told this when we phoned in, it might have saved some time. Free shuttle - if using to leave the hotel, it leaves on the hour. The staff overall were not very helpful and always seemed to act as if it was hard work answering questions, both on the telephone and in person. Overall for the money though it was a good place just for the one night, especially including the free shuttle and breakfast, especially if you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here May 2005 the weekend of Memorial Day and I loved it! The service was excellent and I had a great room for the price $69.99 per night! I had a king size bed with two chairs and a nice bathroom. The rooms were clean-equipped with a nice welcome note and Doritos,Oreos and bottled water! I'm a Hampton Inn fan anyway and have been for 10 years now so they lived up to the Hampton Inn standards I have come to love! This was my first visit to Miami so Hampton Inn made my stay a memorable one! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn for seven days. Rooms were clean and comfortable, good value for the money. Fulll hot Breakfast from 6-10am each day, good selection and good quality. Local phone calls are free and all rooms have free high speed internet access which is awesome is you travel with a laptop or on business. Hotel has a business center with computers to use free of charge. The hotel is right next to the Palmetto 826 which makes it easy to go north or south . There are alot of shopping centers and restaurants within a 5 minute drive of the hotel and the shuttle drivers will take you anywhere within a short distance of the hotel. If you are staying for business or visiting freinds or family in the NW or SW parts of Miami/Dade county this hotel can't be beat. The hotel is also close to the Dolphin mall ,Mall of Americas ,International mall and the Doral Country Club

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to the Usual Hampton Inn Standard”
Reviews.Author: CJKatl
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inns are usually pretty good quality for the dollar, but this was an exception. My room was pretty dirty - complete with the previous guest's used Kleenex on the floor near the head of the bed! Guess that pretty much sums up all you need to know. There was a stale air smell and the neighborhood is kinda sketchy.
